required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on November 19, 2021
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Jaktinib and Azacitidine In Treating Patients With MDS With MF or MDS/MPN With MF.
clinical_study.official_title: A Multicentric Phase I/II Study of Jaktinib Hydrochloride Tablets in Combination With Azacitidine for Injection in Patients With Myelodysplastic Syndromes(MDS) With Myelofibrosis(MF) or MDS/Myeloproliferative Neoplasms With MF

brief_summary.textblock: This phase I/II trial studies how well Jaktinib and azacytidine work in treating patients with myelodysplastic syndromes with myelofibrosis or myelodysplastic syndrome/myeloproliferative neoplasm with myelofibrosis. Giving Jaktinib and azacytidine may be an effective treatment for myelodysplastic syndromes with myelofibrosis or myelodysplastic syndrome/myeloproliferative neoplasm with myelofibrosis.

primary_outcome.measure: Objective response rate (complete remission+partial remission+marrow compete remission +cytogenetic complete remission + hematological improvement) in patients with Myelodysplastic Syndromes
primary_outcome.description: According to the 2006 International Working Group (IWG) response criteria in myelodysplasia，The objective response rate will be estimated along with the Bayesian 95% credible interval.

primary_outcome.measure: Objective response rate (complete remission+cytogenetic complete remission+partial remission+clinical improvement) in patients with myelodysplastic syndromes/myeloproliferative neoplasms
primary_outcome.description: According to the 2015 ICP in MDS/MPN. The objective response rate will be estimated along with the Bayesian 95% credible interval.

secondary_outcome.time_frame: Time from treatment start till death or last follow-up, assessed up to 2 years
secondary_outcome.description: Will be listed and summarized by the Kaplan-Meier estimator

secondary_outcome.time_frame: Duration from the first documented onset of partial response or complete response to the date of progressive disease/relapse, assessed up to 2 years
secondary_outcome.description: Will be listed and summarized by the Kaplan-Meier estimator

secondary_outcome.time_frame: Time from start of response to the date of event defined as the first documented progressive disease/relapse or death, whichever comes first, assessed up to 2 years
secondary_outcome.description: Will be listed and summarized by the Kaplan-Meier estimator

arm_group.description: Patients receive azacitidine subcutaneously (SC) on days 1-7 and Jaktinib orally (PO) twice daily (BID) on days 1-28. Cycles repeat every 28 days in the absence of disease progression or unacceptable toxicity.
